title: Hilali conjecture and complex algebraic varieties
abstract:
A simply connected topological space is called \emph{rationally elliptic} if
the rank of its total homotopy group and its total (co)homology group are both
finite. A well-known Hilali conjecture claims that for a rationally elliptic
space its homotopy rank \emph{does not exceed} its (co)homology rank. In this
paper, after recalling some well-known fundamental properties of a rationally
elliptic space and giving some important examples of rationally elliptic spaces
and rationally elliptic singular complex algebraic varieties for which the
Hilali conjecture holds, we give some revised formulas and some conjectures. We
also discuss some topics such as mixd Hodge polynomials defined via mixed Hodge
structures on cohomology group and the dual of the homotopy group, related to
the ``Hilali conjecture \emph{modulo product}", which is an inequality between
the usual homological Poincar\'e polynomial and the homotopical Poincar\'e
polynomial.
